page.title: 14Floods at Chapel St.Leonards
page.content: In 1571 there was a disastrous high tide which flooded wide areas along the East coast. At Chapel the whole village was destroyed save three houses. The church did not escape either for it was overthrown by the water, only the steeple remained standing. The flood of 1953 will long be remembered by the older inhabitants. A very high wind drove the tide in where it broke through the banks and flooded a good deal of the village. No lives were lost and the protective work carried out on the front has made a repetition of this flooding most unlikely.
